thread.title: Enter weekly pick 'em contest, win prizes
thread.title_full: Enter weekly pick 'em contest, win prizes

title: Enter weekly pick 'em contest, win prizes
text:
Enter weekly pick 'em contest, win prizes Argus Leader Staff 7:28 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Picks of the Week 5 CONNECT 12 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
I figured picking the Longhorns would come back to haunt me last week, but man, given the way they lost that game, I can't be the least bit mad about it. For those of you who missed it, this is what happened: 
That being said, I am a little unhappy about the Vols doing their usual bit and choking away a fourth-quarter advantage. Give up two touchdowns in the final five minutes to lose, two weeks after blowing a 17-point edge against Oklahoma? Brutal. Equally brutal: That bad weekend of football has me sitting in last place. But while I stunk it up, Mick nearly posted our first-ever perfect record. His lone misfire came compliments of the Saints, who couldn't finish off Cam Newton and the Panthers in Carolina. Nonetheless, his 9-1 performance pushed him into a tie with David for first place at 23-7 overall. 
The two leaders in our UPickEm contest, Rusty and bliss, both went a perfect 10-for-10 last week, and now have 18 points overall. 
Now, it's your turn! Follow this here link to our UPickEm.com page and make your picks by 11 a.m. on Saturday for the chance to win a $75 gift card. At the end of the NFL season, the person with the best record will receive a $75 gift card to Buffalo Wild Wings. The second place finisher will receive a $25 gift card. So, come back every week to enter your picks! 
Below are the Argus Sports staff's picks. As always, come for the picks, stay for the locks. You shan't be disappointed. 
STANDINGS 
Mick Garry : 23-7, LOTW: 0-3 (LW: 9-1, 0-1) 
Dave Nicholson : 23-7, LOTW: 1-2 (LW: 8-2, 1-0) 
Matt Zimmer : 21-9, LOTW: 3-0 (LW: 8-2, 1-0) 
Ian Frazer : 20-10, LOTW: 3-0 (LW: 8-2, 1-0) 
Brian Haenchen : 19-11, LOTW: 1-2 (LW: 7-3, 0-1) 
COLLEGE GAMES 
North Dakota State at South Dakota State 
6 p.m. Frazer : South Dakota State Garry : South Dakota State Haenchen : North Dakota State ( After dropping their season opener to Montana 38-35, the Bison have won their last two games by a combined score of 75-23. Also, that receiver RJ Urzendowski is a snootful and I think he'll have a big game Saturday.) Nicholson : South Dakota State 
Youngstown State at South Dakota 
2 p.m.
